name: multi_group_stat
why: Current group_stat requires one call per target column, tedious for 29 internodes or multiple metrics (TL, IN, etc.). Single call computes agg (mean/std/count/etc.) for list of targets by group, reducing 30+ calls to 1. Handles wide data naturally.
returns: DataFrame-like table: rows=groups, columns=targets with agg values (e.g., mean_TL, mean_IN, etc.)

name: batch_numeric
why: Internode columns are object dtype due to '?'; individual coercion works in group_stat but not value_counts/others. Batch converts list/pattern-matched columns to numeric (coerce '?' to NaN), enabling bulk ops without repetition.
returns: Confirmation of converted columns (list), or updated dtypes summary

name: position_stats
why: Core goal is growth patterns by internode position. Computes agg stats for sequential columns (e.g., INTERNODE_1 to _29) only where data exists (IN >= position), by group. Avoids manual filtering/melting for profile analysis.
returns: Table: rows=group+position, columns=agg values (e.g., mean_length_at_1 for control)

name: melt_stats
why: Transforms wide sequential data to long format virtually, then applies group_stat/crosstab etc. in one tool. Enables flexible analysis like violin plots per position/treatment, but outputs stats table.
returns: Aggregated table from melted data (e.g., mean length by TR and position)

name: profile_compare
why: For treatment effects on growth curves: computes/comparisons normalized profiles (e.g., avg length proportion per position, cumulative % of TL). Reduces multi-derive/group steps for pattern insights.
returns: Table of profiles per group (positions vs. normalized metric), with differences to reference
